name: libcanberra

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
libcanberra is an implementation of the XDG Sound Theme and Name
Specifications, for generating event sounds on free desktops, such as
GNOME.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: libxrender
dependencies.description: libXrender - library for the Render Extension to the X11 protocol.

dependencies.name: libxext
dependencies.description: libXext - library for common extensions to the X11 protocol.

dependencies.name: libx11
dependencies.description: libX11 - Core X11 protocol client library.

dependencies.name: libxinerama
dependencies.description: libXinerama - API for Xinerama extension to X11 Protocol.

dependencies.name: libxrandr
dependencies.description: libXrandr - X Resize, Rotate and Reflection extension library.

dependencies.name: libxcursor
dependencies.description: libXcursor - X Window System Cursor management library.

dependencies.name: libxcomposite
dependencies.description:
libXcomposite - client library for the Composite extension to the X11
protocol.

dependencies.name: libxdamage
dependencies.description: This package contains the library for the X Damage extension.

dependencies.name: libxfixes
dependencies.description:
This package contains header files and documentation for the XFIXES
extension. Library and server implementations are separate.

dependencies.name: libxcb
dependencies.description:
The X protocol C-language Binding (XCB) is a replacement for Xlib
featuring a small footprint, latency hiding, direct access to the
protocol, improved threading support, and extensibility.

dependencies.name: libxau
dependencies.description:
The libXau package contains a library implementing the X11 Authorization
Protocol. This is useful for restricting client access to the display.

dependencies.name: gtkplus
dependencies.description:
The GTK+ package contains libraries used for creating graphical user
interfaces for applications.

dependencies.name: libvorbis
dependencies.description:
Ogg Vorbis is a fully open, non-proprietary, patent-and-royalty-free,
general-purpose compressed audio format for mid to high quality (8kHz-
48.0kHz, 16+ bit, polyphonic) audio and music at fixed and variable
bitrates from 16 to 128 kbps/channel.

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and
libraries

dependent_to.name: vizglow
dependent_to.description:
VizGlow software tool is used for high-fidelity multi-dimensional
modeling of non-equilibrium plasma discharges. Note: VizGlow is licensed
software. You will need to create an account on the EsgeeTech homepage
and download VizGlow yourself. Spack will search your current directory
for a file of this format. Alternatively, add this file to a mirror so
that Spack can find it. For instructions on how to set up a mirror, see
https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/mirrors.html
